DOC.brief_title: Whole-body Vibration Induces Short Long Latency Muscular Reflex
DOC.detailed_description: Aim : Whole-body vibration ( WBV ) induce reflex response muscle . The physiological mechanism underlie reflex explain activate muscle spindle ( stretch-induced reflex ) osteocytes ( bone myoregulation reflex ) . WBV-induced muscular reflex ( WBV-IMR ) latency report significantly longer latency T-reflex stretch-induced reflex nearly equal T-reflex latency literature . Hypothesis study WBV activate different receptor reflex pathway depend vibration intensity . Aim study test hypothesis . Methods : 2.1 . Participants Eleven young , healthy right hand dominant male adult volunteer include study . The mean age participant 25.4 ± 4.7 year , mean body height 176.5 ± 6.7 cm mean body weight 77.8 ± 13.8 kg . All volunteer give write informed consent experimental procedure , accordance Declaration Helsinki approve local ethic committee ( Yeditepe University Medical Faculty Clinical Research Evaluation Committee , Istanbul ; 2016/564 ) . 2.2 . Procedure Prior induction WBV , control T-reflex recording elicit participant complete 15-s trial WBV protocol familiarize procedure . Following control T-reflex recording , trial protocol 15-s rest , participant receive three set WBV T-reflex stimulus WBV . A weak vibration apply first set . In next set , moderate strong vibration apply , respectively . Vibration characteristic three set give Table 1 . A WBV set consist four vibration period , last 60 , 5-s rest interval period . Within set , WBV frequencies 25 , 29 , 33 , 37 Hz deliver The surface electromyography ( SEMG ) accelerometer data obtain participant stand upright vibration platform knees extension . The participant barefooted stand directly vibration platform . The whole plate oscillate linear movement upward downward . Two WBV device ( Power-Plate®Pro5 , PowerPlate® International , Ltd. London , UK ) use present study . One use apply moderate strong vibration . The WBV device modify attenuate vibration intensity use apply weak vibration . 2.3 . Data Recordings The recording T-reflex WBV-IMR acquire use SEMG . The Ag/AgCl electrode ( KENDALL®Covidien ) disc radius 10 mm place 20 mm apart right soleus muscle belly shave skin clean alcohol accordance recommendation Surface ElectroMyoGraphy Non-Invasive Assessment Muscles ( SENIAM ) project ( Hermens et al. , 2000 ) . The ground electrode place lateral malleolus . The sampling frequency select 10 kHz . A light ( 2.9 g ) triaxial MEMS piezoaccelerometer ( LIS344ALH , full-scale ± 6 g , linear accelerometer , ECOPACK® ) tap participant 's right Achilles tendon determine timing onset mechanical stimulus T-reflex measure stroke intensity reflex hammer Achilles tendon ( Achilles accelerometer ) . Similar accelerometer fix WBV platform determine time onset mechanical stimulus WBV-IMR ( platform accelerometer ) . Acceleration unit use study m/s2 . A custom-made reflex hammer tap right Achilles tendon caudal accelerometer force 19.6 N. Before vibration vibration session , Achilles tendon tap ten time approximately 3-s interval tap . 2.4.Data process SEMG accelerometer data record use PowerLAB® data acquisition system ( ADInstruments , Oxford , United Kingdom ) data analyze offline use LabChart7® ( ver 7.3.7 , ADInstruments , Oxford , United Kingdom ) software . A sampling frequency 10 kHz use . All accelerometer recording filter high-pass filter set 5 Hz . All EMG recording filter use band pas filter 60 500 Hz . The maximum peak-to-peak ( PPmax ) amplitudes T-reflex determined vibration session . The amplitude WBV-IMR express Root Mean Square ( RMS ) . The PPmax amplitude T-reflex RMS amplitude WBV-IMR record strong WBV use normalize PPmax amplitude T-reflex RMS amplitude WBV-IMR record WBV weak moderate WBV . In present study , reflex latency define time onset mechanical stimulus onset EMG spike cumulate average trace , determine use cumulative average method , previously describe ( Karacan et al ) . The positive peak rectify EMG data use trigger average accelerometer data rectify EMG data . The point cumulative average trace platform accelerometer data standard error ( SE ) low consider stimulus onset point . The point cumulative average trace rectify EMG data SE low consider point onset EMG spike . The mean height young adult male country ( 175 cm ) use normalize T-reflex WBV-IMR latency ( Cidem et al ) . 2.5 . Precautions voluntary muscle contraction motion artifacts Five measure take : 1 ) participant ask use handle WBV device secure balance . The sense balance may impair WBV . Therefore muscle may activate restore balance WBV , 2 ) Before WBV trial , participant ask relax make voluntary contraction low extremity muscle . This instruction provide verbal feedback give researcher monitored SEMG recording screen . If RMS amplitude EMG lower five microvolt intruction , accept muscle relaxation accomplish participant , 3 ) trial protocol apply familiarize vibration , 4 ) cable carefully tap skin minimize motion artifact , 5 ) EMG recording filter avoid WBV induce movement artifact ( Sebik et al. , 2013 ) . 2.6 . Statistical analysis The normal distribution data confirm use Kolmogorov-Smirnov test . Continuous variable summarize arithmetic mean standard deviation ( SD ) . The paired sample t-test use analyze statistical difference amplitude WBV-IMR weak moderate WBV . General linear model repeat measure test use compare T-reflex latency , WBV-IMR latency PPmax amplitude T-reflex among session . The alpha ( α ) threshold choose 0.05 . The Bonferroni test apply pair-wise comparison ( PostHoc analyse ) . Using Bonferroni ( significance level pair-wise comparison α/m , number pair-wise comparison ) , result p value ≤ 0.017 consider significant . Confidence interval ( CI ) , mean , standard error ( SE ) calculate data . When compare mean two data set , ±95 % CI one data set include mean another data set , establish statistical difference mean two data set . The data management software package use PASW statistic ( formerly SPSS Statistics ) Windows .
DOC.criteria: Healthy male Righthanded men Bone , muscle/tendon , joint , vascular , dermatologic disease low extremity spine Medication could affect musculoskeletal system Postural abnormality ( scoliosis , kyphosis , etc ) Systemic disease
